texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Mm? Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh... Ah, huh?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Hahah. You stayed over again?
Still lying on the sofa, I prop myself on an elbow and blink my groggy eyes until reality sets in.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah... Professor!
The realization hits like a bolt out of the blue and I jump to my feet.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm so sorry. I just meant to take a nap, andâ€”

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: No worries. I've had stretches of time where my life was like that too. It brings back memories.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I'm sorry.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: What is it? Were you blessed with another touch of inspiration in your dreams?
He looks at me, his affable demeanor making me feel worse.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, uh...
No matter what I do, Yonagi's face is at the forefront of my mind. All my thoughts end up circling back to that day.
My condition means that the memories don't fade, keeping the emotions I felt at the time as painful as raw as the moment they happened.
Normally, as memories fade, the anger and sadness associated with them erodes as well, giving way for forgiveness and resignation.
But my mind doesn't quite work like that.
All my memories are as vivid as the moment they happened, and the sensations come to me with the same force.
I have no choice but to try and occupy my mind elsewhere, so that it doesn't focus on those memories.
That's how I usually deal with this kind of thing.
However...
My abnormal memory means that I'll just keep accumulating all those negative memories and trying to keep my attention from them, like a trauma.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You don't need waste time listening to my nonsense.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Oh, but I do believe you desperately need someone to talk to right now.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: May I remind you that I've lived three times as long as you. I know it's easy to forget when I look so comparatively young.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'm married, so I also have some degree of experience in marital matters. We're colleagues, and with any luck we'll continue to be so for a long time. Feel free to talk to me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Okay.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Maybe you should wash your face first, though.
The professor brews coffee while I wash my face, brush my teeth, and straighten my crumpled clothes.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How's life in the middle side?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's comfortable, I think.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: ...Now, how is it, really?
I bite at my lower lip in frustration.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The truth is... I'm not sleeping well. Recently, I've lost my appetite too. I only go home to change clothes, pretty much.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's what I always wanted. I finally made it, but...
But what?
I take a moment to think what I'll say next.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Actually living there rings a little hollow compared to what you expected?
I nod in agreement.
His smile turns into a light frown.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Lethargy, is it? That's no good. Do you experience any discomfort when moving?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? Not at all.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's good.
He brings the cup of coffee to his lips and takes a sip.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: What about your partner?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's still living on the lower side. We haven't spoken for a while.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Now I see the cause of your dismay. Your partner must be the kind of person who doesn't have a hard time living in the lower side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It sure seems that way.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: What kind of person is she?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well...
I feel like this is the first time I've talked about Yonagi with him.
I try to think of a sensible place to start from.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There was a time when I was young where I didn't go to school.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Back then, she was the one who invited me to come.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The day I first met her...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That was also the day I met you.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Me?
I nod at him.
Squinting, he seems to ponder for a moment, his gaze focused between the two mugs on his desk.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That day you taught me about motors. You helped me print the exterior of a toy car a few days later.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Was this in the middle square?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: A motor... Ah, yes, I remember that boy. So that was you?
I nod, feeling a little relieved that he remembers.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So that was you! Hahah! You could have told me earlier.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I thought it would have been a little audacious of me. You must have seen many thousands of students through the years.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So that was the day. I remember it very well. You left a big impression on me back then.
He falls silent again, deep in thought.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Yonagi?
I don't believe my ears for a moment.
I had assumed that if he didn't remember me, then he definitely wouldn't remember Yonagi.
He meets around three hundred new students every single year.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You were living with Yonagi?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Yes.
Completely taken aback by the revelation, he looked at me with wide eyes.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Hahahah!
To my surprise, he laughs out loud.
I just sit still, watching.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I never knew!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So your partner was Yonagi this whole time. What a strange coincidence. No, I suppose it's not so surprising when we live in such a small town.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I get it now. I can see how she would enjoy the lowsider life more.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you know Yonagi?
He gives me a resolute nod.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Do you know much about her family?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Nothing at all, actually. That's why we got into an argument when I learned she used to be a midsider.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Of the heated variety?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I always thought she dreamed of becoming a midsider like me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But we lived all these years together, and I never knew she had actually been there before.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This feels like destiny, somehow.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Destiny?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: There's something I need to show you.
A nostalgic smile plays about his face as he goes over his desk, takes a photo frame from it, and comes over to sit in front of me.
He holds the frame out to me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's this?
He smiles at me and nods encouragingly.
Intrigued, I turn lower my gaze to the photo.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's... you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The picture was taken here?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Yes. This was taken over twenty years ago.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's a long time ago.
That said, he doesn't look a day older today than he does in this picture.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Does the other person here remind you of anyone?
There's a man standing next to him.
The first thing that jumps out at me is his white hair and deep red eyes.
This man...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is he Yonagi's...
The professor nods as he sees the realization dawn on me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Her father, yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Her father...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: He was a dear colleague of mine. His name was Shiona.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Shiona... He was a researcher?
The professor nods again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So that's why Yonagi was a midsider...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Because her father was a researcher?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Back then, she lived here in the middle side with Shiona and his wife. She was barely more than a baby at the time.
Her father was a researcher like me?
Why would Yonagi keep this from me?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Well, it must be hard for her to speak of the topic. I ask that you try not to resent her for keeping it a secret.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you mean? Why would it be hard?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Her father was an immensely talented researcher. So much so, in fact, that I found myself jealous of his prowess more often than not.
Professor Asuma has spoken previously of a researcher he once knew. The only person he would call a genius, I recall.
So that was him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So the person you founded the lab with...
He nods again, a glimmer of pride shining in his eyes.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: That's him. The lion's share of the credit for building the foundation of the virtual space system we work on falls to him. I was mostly just making hardware adjustments.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Not to say I was shoddy at my job, but compared with his mastery of the theory and uncanny understanding of the sensory feedback processing, I was working on intern-level tasks.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: He's the one responsible for the foundation of the software that you are developing further now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I see.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But he was unable to keep working on his research, and he and Yonagi got ranked down to lowsiders.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He couldn't? What happened?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: He started forgetting everything. Eventually, he forgot even himself.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Himself?
I've read about the existence of such a brain condition that affected people on the surface from medical books.
But this is the first time I've heard of a case like that down here.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: As to whether his condition was simply a natural occurrence, or the side effect of using himself as a subject for lab trials time and time again...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: To this day, no one can tell. But not a day goes by where I don't think of the endless guilt I carry with me.
He says, his gaze apparently miles away.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You feel guilty for not noticing it was happening before it was too late?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: No...
The professor turns to me, his mouth settling into a hard line.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I feel guilty for not yet being able to finalize the research he gave his life for.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If I was in his shoes, I'm certain I wouldn't have wanted to be pitied.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see...
The professor fills the silence with a sip of his coffee.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: And the one person that stood by him to the end was Yonagi.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But he... He didn't know who he was, let alone who the small girl by his bedside was.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: And he left this world like that, not knowing who anyone in his life was.
I look down at my cup of coffee.
Coffee gone cold, hardly appetizing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I had no idea...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So Yonagi rejected the idea of living here in the middle side?
I recall her sad expression once more.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't think she rejected it exactly. But she wasn't happy about it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She told me she wanted me to wait.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She wanted to make sure of something before giving me her answer.
And then, something clicks in my head.
Why would she refuse moving with me to the middle side?
Why would she say it was because she got complacent?
I try to put all the pieces together and formulate a hypothesis.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Most people who live in the middle side are qualified to do so because of the work they perform.
I halt my thoughts and turn back to him.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: When people lose their jobs, like Yonagi's father, they are ranked down to lowsiders.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But back then, her mother stayed in the middle side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She did? How?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: She remarried with another researcher.
I stared at him, stunned.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What? People can just do that?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The system allows for divorce and remarriage. Moral implications aside, you can indeed do such a thing.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: All within the rules, of course.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: As for what is the right or wrong thing to do, or what a person ought to do and not do with their life, I cannot say.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Whatever the case may be, it is clear that remaining a midsider was of the utmost priority for her mother.
The desolation in her expression back then takes on a whole new meaning now.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'd be lying if I said I couldn't relate to her mother's feelings.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Perhaps that's why she's so determined to appreciate life as a lowsider.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Maybe she doesn't want to admit that the way of life her mother so readily abandoned her for is worthless.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: She always called the forced labor lowsiders do a 'job.' I think she desperately wanted to form an attachment to that life. See the positive side of it, perhaps.
All these years...
Yonagi has always called the forced labor her 'job.'
I have no recollection of her ever using the word 'labor' to refer to it.
Which means that she hasn't ever used the word, at least in front of me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is all news to me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Forgive me. I did notice you were acting strangely, but I should have said something sooner.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's okay...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It'd be better if you heard about it from Yonagi herself.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I believe she has very mixed feelings about her family.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If there's anyone that could help her, I imagine that'd be you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm sorry, I...
The professor nods, directing a knowing smile at me.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's okay. Go to her. I'll send you the location data for the place where she and her father lived.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thank you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: *Huff* *Huff*
What Yonagi wanted to make sure of...
I'm almost certain I know what that is now.
I recall the knowledge I learned from those surface books.
Specifically, about a disease once called Alzheimer's.

It's a disease that occurs when a malignant protein called beta-amyloid is produced in high amounts inside the brain, clumping together and collecting between neurons, disrupting and impeding a person's memory.
There were several treatments, but they all served merely to alleviate the suffering of the patient. At the very least, humankind never found a definitive cure for it while on the surface.
Ten percent of the people who develop this condition do so from genetic causes.
Due to being born with an extra chromosome twenty-one.
Which means...
There's a chance that Yonagi inherited the disease from her father.
Regardless of whether or not it occurred in him as a side effect of experimentation, it's possible that he passed it down to her.
That must be what Yonagi's trying to ascertain.
She wants to know if she'll lose herself one day.
She was upset with herself for not having the courage to tell me. She didn't want to hurt me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why?! What am I here for then?!
I can understand why she wouldn't want to tell me.
But I want her to rely on me.
I want her to believe in me.
I kick up dirt on my mad rush back home.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Mm?
I haven't been to my lower side home in several days.
As I swing the door open, I'm not met with Yonagi, but with Izumo staring right into my face by the entrance.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi...

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Not here.
I look up at the wall clock.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's still at work?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: No.
I snap my head back to Izumo.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: She hasn't been here in the last six days.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: She went to work one day and didn't come back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I don't know. Nothing was said to me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can't you locate her chip?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Only you are registered as my owner. You are the only person I can perform automatic tracking on.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Dammit!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Shall I search for Yonagi's current location data?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Please do.
If she's not here, there's only one other place she could be.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Displaying location data.
She's in the lower side.
And her location is consistent with what the professor sent me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The place where she lived with her father...

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Are you going?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I'm glad to hear that.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Please tell Yonagi that I await her return.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, thanks.
The location data leads me to a cluster of small buildings nestled deep into the lower side.
Our house faces the cornfield, and there's actually a view outside the window, so it's well situated, all things considered.
But deeper in the lower side, the middle side blocks out the sunlight, and everything is dark and musty.
The heavy dust is so intense that it's almost hard to keep one's eyes open.
I wade my way through the tight corridors and find the place.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This must be it.
I stand in front of the old house and knock on the door.
I rap on it a few times, eliciting no answer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi? Are you there?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm coming in.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Okay.
The first thing that I notice...
Is the lack of natural light in here.
Full bookshelves cover the walls with countless notes stuck to them.
I notice a familiar hardcover notebook open in the middle of the only desk in the cramped space.
It's the novel Yonagi's writing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You've been writing a novel?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
She has a somewhat vacant expression on her face.
It's a far cry from her usual cheery demeanor.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Forgive me, Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: For what?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Did the professor tell you about this place?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I also had Izumo look up your location.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see...
The silence extends excruciatingly.
I turn my eyes to the notebook spread open on the desk.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Still writing the story about Shakespeare?
She shakes her head slowly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There's no point in writing that one anymore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Now I'm writing the novel I never wanted to write.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm writing about what I always tried to turn away from. What I've been running away from.
She shows me a tired smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You heard about my dad, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
I can't remember a time where her smile looked sadder than this.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sorry for keeping quiet this whole time. I figured I would need to tell you someday.
Her calm tone rings through the room.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo told me you haven't been home in a while. You've been here writing this whole time?
She doesn't answer the question.
Instead, her gaze wanders between us.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What is the one thing that you would never want to forget?
Somehow, I feel like this question means a lot of things.
I don't get the impression that she means any moment or person in particular.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: For me, it's my feelings.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The sadness I felt, my anger, and my happiness, of course.
I nod back.
She's said something similar before.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even if I'm not able to remember every detail of a moment like you can.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The one thing I don't want to forget is what I felt in my heart. That's all.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I believe that's what makes me who I am.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You remember the first story we made up together, right?
I nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: When I read Sumomo's story, I remember how I felt when we discovered that clearing with the flowers back when we were kids.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That day we found a beautiful spot where we could see the beautiful sky, hidden so close to the path we walked every day.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It helps me remember how exciting it was to go through that tunnel for the first time, holding hands.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And when I read Olivia's story, I can relate to the confusion of growing so close with the man I love. Too close for him to notice that I wanted more.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You and Will both have such tunnel vision, after all.
She says, a small chuckle leaving her lips.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I guess I also put some of my desires into Olivia. My wish that I could be feminine like her, able to use my charm to make your head turn.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Then why did you...
Yonagi stays silent as I speak.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why do all those stories end up with them saying goodbye in the end?
After a moment, she turns to the notebook open on the desk and traces the lines with her fingers.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Because by the time I need these books I wrote...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You won't be there anymore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You won't be by my side by then.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Why are you so sure about that?
She shakes her head slowly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm not doubting your feelings.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If I died as I am now, I'm sure you'd stay by my side to the end.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But when that time comes, I won't be me anymore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you understand what I'm saying?
After a moment's pause, I nod.
I've been studying the brain and memory for a long time.
I know what happens in cases like these.
I know what's at the end of the road for people with advanced memory loss.
Where does the self lie?
What gives a person their personality?
Their memories, that's it.
A person's individuality lies in their memories.
And when those are lost, whose soul then inhabits that drained vessel?
When all the moments and memories she cherished deep in her heart are gone, will the person who remains really be her?
I don't think I have the answer to that right now.
But I understand what she's saying.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even then, I want to...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: When the time comes, I want to be able to look back on the path that got me where I am.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to read those stories and remember.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's my parting gift, from me to her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why...
Her gaze shifts from the notebook to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: They need to be farewell stories.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't want to ignore the huge sadness I feel over how I know it'll end. I want to let myself remember that I was happy, and that's why my sadness was so great.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: When I'm no longer myself...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: When I don't know who I am, who you are, where I am, or what year it even is anymore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: When I don't know what I wanted, or who I loved.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't want you to see me like that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You looked into it already?
When she hears that, she stops on the spot.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You were trying to find out if your father's condition is hereditary, right?
Yonagi smiles at me and looks into my eyes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...It was positive. I inherited it.
The answer sinks in like a rock to the bottom of a well.
I find myself unable to speak.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There's no such thing as miracles in this world, huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But of course there isn't. We don't live in a novel.
It feels like she's talking to life itself rather than to anyone in particular.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sorry for keeping it from you all this time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sorry for staying with you without telling you anything.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well... Even if you do have the gene, are you certain you'll experience the symptoms? And if we know it's gonna happen, we canâ€”
Yonagi shakes her head and holds a hand up to stop me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You don't know what it's like, Kaito. You don't know what it feels like to see a loved one lose themselves in front of your eyes like that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No matter how smart you are, there's no way you can comprehend it without experiencing it firsthand. And I don't want you to have to go through that.
Yonagi reaches for a sketchbook sitting on one of the shelves in the center of the room. She slowly opens it up and flips through the pages.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: This is what my father kept drawing until he passed away.
Pages upon pages depict the same woman.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Who's that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: His ex-wife.
The person the professor spoke of.
The woman who abandoned her sick husband and her child.
Yonagi's mother.
Her choice of words to refer to the woman doesn't escape me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: He kept drawing her every day, right up until the last moment.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even after he forgot about his daughter, he kept on drawing her.
She murmurs, her face betraying no expression.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I understand my dad didn't do it out of malice. He didn't even know who he was drawing.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She just abandoned us like we meant nothing. Do you think I could forgive her for that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Even when I was the one by his side to the end, he never called my name even once.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But he kept on drawing her till his last day. How could I ever forgive a person like that?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's what I want to know.
A thin line of tears streaks her cheeks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wished I could just forget my past. All of it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I thought that it would be so much easier if I could forget what that woman did to my dad.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sometimes I wonder if wishing so hard for it...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...made it come true in the end.
Her voice sounds ghostly, like a shade fading at dawn.
She looks at me with an expression I've never seen before on her face.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, it isn't your fault.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: When I came back here a few days ago, I understood your pain for the first time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Always remembering things you would rather forget must be hard. Every single detail as if it happened moments ago.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe it really is easier to just forget it all.
Never before has Yonagi seemed more frail than in this moment.
Like a statue of crystal, really to collapse at the slightest touch.
Ironically...
That fragility gives her a solemn, enduring beauty. This is one moment that will stay seared in my mind forever, brighter than all else.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But now that I'm aware of my condition, now that I understand it, I want to face my life like I always should have.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to use these feelings while I remember them to write a story that will help me recall them later.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why I'm finally writing about myself. I finally started writing it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: A story about a lonely girl who could never face her father.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe this story will help reflect those feelings vividly when I start to forget.
I stand there, gazing at her turned profile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sorry for making you wait for the answer. I'll give it to you now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi, I...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can't be together with you. You're the one person in the world who I don't want to see me when I'm no longer myself.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Please be happy, Kaito. I know you will.
I stare at her, mouth half open as I search for the words.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I became a researcher and got a middle side house like I always wanted.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's spacious, quiet, clean...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Everything I ever wanted.
I can see the pain behind her smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You worked really hard for it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It didn't make me happy. It wasn't fulfilling.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The food didn't taste like anything, and I couldn't sleep.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even walking back to that house I always wanted felt painful.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You know why.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Because you weren't there.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Neither you nor Izumo.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Nothing inside of that fridge was good enough.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Nothing tasted better than eating the porridge Izumo makes together in our home.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I realized that I was happy there.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito, that's why I...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I came here because I finally made up my mind.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There is nothing more important to me than our time together. There's no point in living if you're not with me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I'll stop being myself someday.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You know I would stay by your side forever if I could. There's nothing I would love more.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want to break things off now because I know I can't do that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's better for us that way.
Yonagi says, before turning her back to me.
I can see her shoulders trembling as she stands there.
How could I be so blind?
Yonagi, she always...
Every day she showed me how precious our life together was for her, her every action and gesture overflowing with pure love.
What was I doing?
What else did I need?
I take a step closer and reach out to her trembling shoulders.
Her scent tickles my nose.
I gently wrap her trembling body in my embrace.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whether or not you're still you...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can decide that for myself.
I notice her eyes narrowing as she lowers her head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's for me to decide.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even if you forget about me, or yourself, I'll be there for you. I'll be there till the end.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You don't understand anything... You don't get it, Kaito.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: When it happens, I won't even remember the time we had together. I won't know who you are, or why you're even there by my side.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And when I don't recognize you, I'm sure you won't recognize me either.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know what it's like. I saw it happen.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm telling you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When you're no longer you, I'll stay and tell the person who comes after about us. I'll keep telling her our stories.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How we met, how we lived together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And how we came apart...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll keep telling that person about it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Just like you'll write out your feelings for them, I'll give them my memories.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll keep on thinking of you. Like I always do.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: As long as I do that, you'll keep on living in me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You gave me your answer, and this is mine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You can't just...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: His name was Shiona, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I never met him, nor even heard his voice, but...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He was the one who built up the foundation for the algorithm I installed into Wooleep.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm using what he and Professor Asuma made together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When the professor showed me a picture of him, he told me that Shiona's genius made him jealous.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When you tell someone about a person, an image of that person grows within them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even if it's just a pale reflection of them, if you keep on doing it...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your dad can live on in the hearts of others.
I catch sight of something in the corner of my eye.
Yonagi is breaking into silent tears in my arms.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Tell me about the kind of man your father was to you. What was he like?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even if you were to forget, I never will. Not a single thing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll remember every precious memory you have. I'll keep telling you about them until I can no more.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll stay by your side, forever.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You have more important things to be doing than worrying about me, don't you? Aren't you trying to save people from this life of confinement underground?
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And you're one of those people I want to save, but I...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I want to ask for your forgiveness. At some point I forgot what my real goal was.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I didn't become a researcher to abandon you. I never wanted to make you sad.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I still remember how you looked when you left the house in the middle side.
Her breathing is slow and faint.
Even now, I can feel it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't ever want to make you miserable like that again. This time away from you made me realize...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The most important thing in my life... The one thing I truly want from the bottom of my heart. I finally know what it is.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So please, don't cry anymore. I want you to smile.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Even more so if we know your time is limited... I want to treasure our time together. Make it the best time of our lives.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I can't let you bear all those memories alone after I'm gone. I don't want you to be alone...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't care if it'll be over one day.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't care if you forget about it someday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I still want to spend the time we have together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So, please...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's live together again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I won't have children. I don't want to make anyone else suffer like me. I won't be able to leave anything to you. I would just... steal your time away.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You still want to be with me? You want to marry a woman who can't give you anything?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All you need to leave me with is the memories we make together. That's enough for me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: My good memory will come in handy for once.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...That's not true. You're just trying to be kind.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I've got to make up for being an oblivious idiot for so long somehow.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: *Sniff* Oh, you dummy.
A faint smile breaks across her face.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go home. Izumo's waiting for us.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She must be lonely.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She wanted me to tell you that she's been waiting for you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let me read your new book.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Tell me everything about you.
I feel her take a deep breath.
The tears continue running down her cheeks in a silent stream.
Today, for the first time...
I came to know how delicate Yonagi really is.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you sure about this? You won't regret it later?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No. Not ever. I swear.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's get married. Let's be together, as husband and wife.
Yonagi gives me a small nod.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Yes.
Yonagi puts a hand over her mouth, unable to contain the tears flooding down her face.
I've come to know a new side of her today.
And I've realized something else too.
It's my responsibility and my desire to commit all of her to mind, and remember for the both of us.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thank you, Kaito.
We walk through the lower side streets, holding hands.
This place is definitely a tough sell.
The air is stagnant, it's humid and dark. You can't get away from the stench of fertilizer.
But...
All I can focus on is the warmth of Yonagi's hand in mine.
That makes everything else seem secondary.
I suppose my hypothalamus must be slacking off and not processing all the sensory information it should be receiving.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you want to live in the middle side?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I wonder about that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The experience so far has left me ambivalent to it, I suppose.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm not sure if that's good or bad, though.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It is convenient to live near the institute, but I've realized I don't actually mind walking through the cornfields.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm fine living wherever you want to be.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We have so many memories with Mom in that house; that's why I like it. But I don't want to get in the way of your work.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If it'll help your research, I don't mind moving to the middle side.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It made your commute easier, didn't it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's no hurry to make a decision. I'll tell the professor I'll be staying in the lower side again for a while.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Won't you lose the house up there?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll ask about it. But he told me a lot of midsiders have houses in the lower side as well.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't think it really matters where I live.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Though I suppose there aren't a lot of midsiders who would rather live in the lower side.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see.
We stay silent for a while as we slowly make our way through the cornfield on our way home.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wonder if it's okay...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: To feel this happy.
She says, looking a bit bashful.
We continue walking together for a while before I figure my answer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think you're asking the wrong question.
I turn back to look at her and continue.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why shouldn't we be happy? We need to be happy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's our duty to make the moments we spend together happy and worthwhile.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We have to make more happy stories so I can tell them back to you later.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Isn't that right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's treasure our time together. Even if we fightâ€”and I know we will sometimesâ€”let's talk things over and not dwell on them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We don't have time to be falling out, I should think.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah. We've got to be open about our feelings.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
We lapse into silence after that.
But it's not an uncomfortable silence.
It's full of the certainty that our connection goes beyond words.
The realization that there's nothing else to say, at least for now.
It's a fulfilling sensation, for sure.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...We're going to bed together tonight, okay?
My head snaps back to her.
I'm met with her big eyes upturned to me, and a rosy blush gracing her cheeks.
Perhaps we do need to talk about one more thing tonight.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You know what I'm trying to say, right?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're the one who said we needed to be open, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, of course.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know you won't get the hint unless I hit you over the head with it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was thinking the mood was gonna take us there anyway, but I had to make sure.
Thank goodness she did.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: God knows how long you'd keep me waiting if today didn't persuade you to make a move.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You've been waiting?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Of course, you big dummy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see... Oh man...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No cold feet now, okay? You want to know everything about me, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right.
We keep walking through the chilly fields.
But then something hits me.
Izumo's back home.
How can we do anything with her there?
Is it okay if we just... do it in front of her?
I mean, it's not like she's actually a person.
But I can't imagine having someone stare as we make love is very conducive to a romantic mood.
That's not how it works, right?
What do I do now?
Maybe ask Izumo to go out on an errand?
It'll be the first time I ask her do something like that.
Will she be okay? I don't want her getting lost...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahahah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Your hand's super sweaty! Are you nervous?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How could I not be? It's my first time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Don't worry, it'll be mine too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's something else worrying me, though.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What should we tell Izumo?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, I see what you mean.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um, maybe we should ask her to go outside while we, uh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well, duh! It'd be like something from a horror novel if Izumo was stood there staring at us while we did it for the first time!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, right.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I doubt she would mind if we did anything in front of her, though.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I know what you mean.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What should we do when we get home?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You know, the whole thing they do in Japanese novels? Dinner, bath, orâ€”

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Now I have to play the wife?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uhh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay, let's go with dinner! I'm sure Izumo will want us to have dinner no matter what.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's been a while, and we need to apologize to her. We've kind of left her in the dark with this whole thing between us.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I've missed her porridge.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We're back!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hello there.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Welcome back.
Izumo and Wooleep come to greet us like nothing happened.
Coming home together like this reminds me of the days when we still worked together in the lower side. It's kind of nostalgic.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sorry for leaving you alone for so long, Izumo.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You can start making meals for two from now on.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood. Will you be dining now?
Yonagi and I exchange glances.
I notice her happy smile and feel my chest swell with relief.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, we're starving!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I'll prepare dinner at once.
Dinner is, of course, porridge.
When we finish eating, Izumo clears away the plates and starts washing them.
My eyes meet Yonagi's.
That's enough to make my face grow hot.
She looks at me and smiles fondly.
Looking at those soft cheeks, I can't help but wonder how soft the rest of her may be.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, Izumo?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can I, uh, ask you to take care of an errand?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can you do it?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: An errand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I, erm, so it's about the house in the middle side. There's some stuff in there I want you to fetch.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood. What is it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Like my books, and my mobile terminal.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood. The middle side, correct? Please send the destination data and the list of objects to retrieve.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: O-Okay...

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I shall go now.
Izumo goes out the door with Wooleep in tow.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...I feel like we're being kinda mean.
Yonagi has a slightly troubled smile on her face as she watches the door close behind Izumo.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I guess...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Still, I feel like Izumo feels a lot better when the three of us and Wooleep are together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Though I could just be imagining things.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No, I think the same. She looked really lonely when you weren't around.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
I straighten my posture on the chair and look at her again.
Admittedly, I feel nervous simply thinking about what's about to happen.
I try to keep my cool, hoping she doesn't notice.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Could you turn off the lights?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, sure...
I get up hurriedly and flip the light switch.
When I turn back, I find Yonagi standing in front of me.
She comes over to me slowly, directing a meaningful smile my way. Somehow, she reminds of Olivia right now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...
I'm too stunned to do anything but nod.
Her face gets closer and closer.
She cups my cheek with one hand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm so happy.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And it's all thanks to you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm happy too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want you to know everything there is to know about me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And I want to know more about you too.
I nod again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We've lived together for so long already, but it sure took us a while to get here, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry about that...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I've been waiting for this for so long. You had no idea, did you?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm done waiting now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you ready?
When I nod once more, Yonagi cups my other cheek gently.
She brings her face closer... and our lips meet.
I can feel the warm touch of her soft lips on mine.
I carefully wrap an arm around her waist and pull her closer.
She accepts the gesture, entrusting herself to me.
There's no more distance between us.
Her scent surrounds me.
Each sensation my senses experience comes together into an orchestra of pure bliss.
I feel her faint breath brushing against my face.
Our lips stay locked for longer than I care to count.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...
I see the pure passion burning in her eyes.
It's like fire, seeping into me and burning me from inside.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We're not stopping here, are we?
I shake my head in response.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know if I'll be any good at this, though...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm doing it with you, and that's all that matters.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It doesn't matter if you need to learn your way at first.
Yonagi brings her lips in close to my ear.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I want you to make love to me.
She whispers, planting a kiss on my ear before pulling back.
Then she looks up at me through her lashes, a seductive smile playing across her lips.
It is the first time I've seen such an expression on her face.
A pale light seeps in through the window.
The only things visible outside are the tall stalks of the cornfields.
The moon is hidden from sight, though its pale glow remains.
Yonagi rests her head on my chest, her shoulders rising and falling as she breathes.
We're sharing the bed, her bare skin in contact with mine.
Never before have I connected so deeply with someone.
I bask in the happiness of the moment as I stroke her silky white hair.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you think Mom knew we were gonna end up like this someday?
I turn my gaze down at her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Become a couple like this?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wonder about that.
I murmur as I keep stroking her hair.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I bet she knew.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Probably.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm sorry I can't have your baby.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But you wanted children, didn't you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I realized something while living up there. Happiness isn't all about the ideal I have in my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Someday, when you forget it all...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Being able to tell the Yonagi who's left behind about us will be one form of happiness for me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thank you, Kaito. Thank you so much.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And sorry... I'm so sorry...
She buries her face in my chest.
I can feel her warm tears on my skin.
I keep on stroking her hair.
There's no point trying to sugarcoat things.
We've decided not to run away from reality anymore.
Someday she'll forget.
And we need to accept that.
Her soft sobbing...
The warmth of her tears, and the softness of her skin on mine...
Committing all of it to memory and engraving it deep into my soul...
That is my duty from today onward.
